desc: SDHAF2 encodes a tumor suppressor involved in the electron transport chain. Germline mutations of SDHAF2 are associated with head and neck parangangliomas.

SDHAF2 (Succinate dehydrogenase assembly factor 2) encodes a protein critical to the appropriate assembly of the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) protein complex, which physically resides in the inner membrane of mitochondria (PMID: 19628817). In particular, SDHAF2 ensures appropriate incorporation of flavin adenine dinucleotide (FAD) into the SDH complex (PMID:19628817). Mutations of glycine 78 to arginine in SDHAF2 have been associated with hereditary head and neck parangangliomas in two different studies (PMID: 20071235, 21224366). Paragangliomas associated with SDHAF2 mutations typically have a young age of onset, and do not co-occur with mutations in SDH components (e.g. SDHA). Notably, it was identified in both studies that children who inherited a maternal mutant SDHAF2 allele were not affected by disease, suggesting that parent-of-origin for the mutant allele is important in the development of the disease (PMID: 21771581).

articles.title: SDHAF2 mutations in familial and sporadic paraganglioma and phaeochromocytoma.
articles.reference: Bayley JP et al. The Lancet. Oncology. 2010 Apr;11(4)366-72.
